高中英语单词|ability|英[ə'bɪləti] 美[ə'bɪləti]|n.能力；才能|This is a task well within your ability.<br>She has the ability to keep calm in an emergency.<br>He is a man of great executive ability.<br>The boy shows remarkable ability at math.<br>He shows exceptional ability in solving problems.|这完全是你力所能及的工作。<br>她有处变不惊的本事。<br>他是个具有极高管理才能的人。<br>这男孩显示出非凡的数学才能。<br>他处理问题才干过人。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|abnormal|英[æb'nɔːml] 美[æb'nɔːrml]|adj.反常的；不正常的；变态的<br>n.不正常的人|We were very surprised at his abnormal behavior.<br>At one time, she is fine, but at another, she is abnormal.<br>He is mentally abnormal.<br>It's abnormal for the boy to eat so much.<br>It is important to make a study of abnormal psychology.<br>Prolonged exposure to lead peroxide can cause abnormal pain, nausea, and vomiting.|我们对他的反常行为感到非常吃惊。<br>有时候，她表现得很好，有时候又失常。<br>他精神不正常。<br>这个孩子吃这么多是不正常的。<br>研究变态心理学是重要的。<br>长期接触铅可引起不正常的过氧化疼痛，恶心和呕吐。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|aboard|英[ə'bɔːd] 美[ə'bɔːrd]|adv.在船上；在火车上；在飞机上<br>prep.上船；上飞机；上车|Little Tom and the sailors spent two months aboard.<br>All passengers aboard fell into the river.<br>A limited menu is available aboard the train, but a nice bottle of vin rouge and a simple picnic hamper will enhance your Orient-Express fantasy.<br>They were the last two to go aboard the ship.<br>We must not take combustible goods aboard.<br>Passengers may only take aboard the aircraft a minimum of luggage.|小汤姆和水手们在船上过了两个月。<br>船上所有乘客皆落入河中。<br>在火车上提供的食物很有限，自备一瓶上好法国红葡萄酒和一份简单的野餐食盒，将会提升你东方快车之旅的乐趣。<br>他们是最後两位上船的。<br>我们不可以带易燃物品上船。<br>乘客上飞机时，只可以带最少量的行李。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|account|英[ə'kaʊnt] 美[ə'kaʊnt]|n.账户；帐目；赊账；老主顾；报告；描述；解释；说明；估计；理由；利益；好处；根据<br>v.解释；导致；报账；把……视为；归咎（于）|She squared her account at the store.<br>We have accounts with most of our suppliers.<br>The agency has lost several of its most important accounts.<br>This is a particular account of the accident.<br>She gave an accurate account of the case.<br>His account contradicted itself.<br>Lynne gave us a detailed account of her plan.<br>We must take full account of our difficulties.<br>On no account shall the Parties evade the responsibility for the loss of profits.<br>He turned his writing skills to good account.<br>On that account, it is best to do so.<br>He has been asked to account for his conduct.<br>A man is accounted innocent until he is proven guilty.|她在商店里结清帐目。<br>我们与大多数供应商都是实行赊购制。<br>这家代理机构失去了几家最重要的老客户。<br>这是一份全面而详尽的事故报告。<br>她对事故做了准确的描述。<br>他的解释自相矛盾。<br>关于计划<br>我们对困难要有足够的估计。<br>协议双方均不得以任何理由逃避对方利益损失的责任。<br>他利用他的写作技巧来获利。<br>根据那一点，我们最好就这么做。<br>他被要求解释他的行为。<br>一个人未被证明有罪前，被视为是清白的。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|accuracy|英['ækjərəsi] 美['ækjərəsi]|n.准确（性）；精确度|He's a man of accuracy and strict method.<br>Accuracy is more important than speed in his new job.<br>I can predict something with great accuracy.<br>It is impossible to say with any accuracy how many are affected.<br>The accuracy of the parallel increased.|他是个精细而严谨的人。<br>对他的新工作，准确比速度更重要。<br>我能很准确地预测某事。<br>无论如何也说不准受影响的有多少。<br>这种比拟变得愈来愈确切了。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|acid|英['æsɪd] 美['æsɪd]|n.酸；酸性物质；<俚>迷幻药<br>adj.酸的；酸性的；尖酸的|Acids react with bases to form salts.<br>The acid burnt a hole in the carpet.<br>The acid has burnt a hole in my jacket.<br>The acid in the rain slowly ate away at the stone wall.<br>Add more sugar if it tastes too acid.<br>These plants prefer an acid soil.<br>She uttered the phrase with acid sarcasm.|酸与碱反应生成盐。<br>酸把地毯烧了个洞。<br>这种酸把我的上衣烧了一个窟窿。<br>雨水中的酸性物质慢慢侵蚀着石墙。<br>如果尝着太酸的话就多放点糖。<br>这些植物喜酸性土壤。<br>她以辛辣的讽刺口吻说这个词。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|argue|英['ɑːɡjuː] 美['ɑːrɡjuː]|v.说服；争论；辩论|We argued her into joining us.<br>The United States should, he argues, attempt to remain aloof.<br>As we've seen, the experts argue about which diet is best.<br>They argued the case for hours.|我们说服她参加了宴会。<br>他认为，美国应保持超然态度。<br>正如我们所看见，而专家们争论，是最好的饮食。<br>他们就这个案子辩论了几个小时。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|argument|英['ɑːɡjumənt] 美['ɑːrɡjumənt]|n.辩论；论点；论据；争论；理由；（函数）自变量|She handled a difficult argument skilfully.<br>This argument, however, does not hold water.<br>This point is vital to my argument.<br>We accepted the agreement without argument.<br>The argument among the two parties was blown up by the press.<br>It is not a logically compelling argument.<br>The argument of the function was misrepresented.<br>Consider a method that takes a String as its argument.|她巧妙地应付了一场艰难的辩论。<br>但是，这种观点是站不住脚的。<br>这一点对我的论据极为重要。<br>我们毫无异议地接受了这一协议。<br>双方的争论被新闻界夸大了。<br>它在逻辑上并不是令人信服的理由。<br>这个函数的自变量出现表达错误。<br>下面让我们考虑将一个字串作为自变量使用的方法。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|arise|英[ə'raɪz] 美[ə'raɪz]|vi.出现；升起；上升；发生；起来|An opportunity has arisen.<br>Tell our comrades to keep calm when problems arise.<br>Notice what emotions arise within you.<br>Whatever it is, let it arise and look at it mindfully.<br>The times of cleansing shall be due to many diseases that will arise as the temperature of Earth continues to rise due to her global ascension.<br>Accidents often arise from carelessness.<br>Various new problems may arise in future.<br>The problem may not arise, but there's no harm in keeping our powder dry.<br>Arise, LORD, come to your resting place, you and your majestic ark.|机会来了。<br>告诉同志们遇事要沉着。<br>注意到在你内心升起的情绪。<br>无论是什么，让它升起，觉知的观察它。<br>净化时代将是由于许多疾病的缘故，这些疾病将由于是地球气温因全球提升而上升的情况而出现。<br>事故往往起因于粗心。<br>将来可能会出现种种新问题。<br>问题不一定会发生，但有备无患并无害处。<br>上主，请你和你威严的约柜，起来驾临到你安息的地宅。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|astronomy|英[ə'strɒnəmi] 美[ə'strɑːnəmi]|n.天文学|Physics and astronomy are cognate sciences.<br>Astronomy, as distinct from astrology, is an exact science.<br>Astronomy is the scientific study of the sun, moon, and stars and other heaven bodies.<br>We're at cross-purposes: I'm talking about astronomy, you're talking about astrology.|物理学和天文学是相关联的科学。<br>天文学是一门严谨的科学，与占星术完全不同。<br>天文学是研究太阳、月亮、星星和其他天体的科学。<br>我们彼此误解了：我谈的是天文学，你谈的是占星术。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|atmosphere|英['ætməsfɪə(r)] 美['ætməsfɪr]|n.大气；空气；气氛；气压|The burning of fossil fuels results in the pollution of the atmosphere.<br>The atmosphere of the city is very much polluted.<br>The atmosphere changed as soon as she walked in.<br>The atmosphere over dinner was warm and friendly.<br>The atmosphere pressure gradient is an inverse measure of the spacing of the isobars on a weather map.<br>The water droplets ejected by the gun expand in the atmosphere because it is at lower pressure than the air used to make the droplets.|矿物燃料的燃烧导致了大气污染。<br>那个城市的空气受到严重污染。<br>她一进来气氛就变了。<br>用餐时洋溢著热情友好的气氛。<br>气压梯度与天气图上等压线的间隔大小成反比。<br>由于大气气压比造雪炮中气压低，雪炮中的水滴被喷射到空气中。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|chaos|英['keɪɒs] 美['keɪɑːs]|n.混乱；无秩序；混沌|The wintry weather has caused chaos on the roads.<br>Without rules, people would live in a state of chaos.<br>Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit.<br>The Chaos gods demand their souls.|因风雪交加，道路上混乱不堪。<br>若无规则，人们将在混乱状态中生活。<br>混沌常常孕育着生命，而秩序会产生习惯。<br>混沌邪神需要他们的灵魂。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|character|英['kærəktə(r)] 美['kærəktər]|n.个性；品质；字符；人物；名誉；地位<br>adj.[剧]（角色）代表某一特性的|The boy has a strong character.<br>He is remembered for the nobility of his character.<br>We need only keep track of the last marked character.<br>I never saw a character so thoroughly hit off .<br>His character is without a blemish.<br>She is responsible for the character part of the hero's devoted mother.|这孩子个性很强。<br>他因品质高尚而被人怀念。<br>我们只要记住最后标记的字符。<br>我从没看见过一个人物被描写得如此淋漓尽致。<br>他在名誉上毫无瑕疵。<br>她负责这个主人公的忠诚的母亲的角色部分。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|characteristic|英[ˌkærəktə'rɪstɪk] 美[ˌkærəktə'rɪstɪk]|n.特点；特性；特色<br>adj.典型的；特有的|Ambition is a characteristic of all successful businessmen.<br>A characteristic of the camel is its ability to live for a long time without water.<br>They have been affected by trends in Italy too much to keep their own characteristics.<br>It is the characteristic attitude of people towards life in those post-war years.<br>Sympathy is the feeling characteristic of mankind.|雄心勃勃是所有成功生意人的共同特点。<br>骆驼的特点是不喝水也能活很长时间。<br>他们受意大利潮流的影响太大了，以致无法保持自己的特色。<br>这是战后人们典型的处世态度。<br>同情心是人类特有的感情。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|charge|英[tʃɑːdʒ] 美[tʃɑːrdʒ]|n.责任；电荷；指控；费用；照顾<br>vi.要价；充电；向前冲，冲锋；记在账上<br>vt.控诉；赊帐；给…充电；委以重任；归罪于；装填（炸药等）|As group leader, you should take charge.<br>He was arrested on a charge of armed robbery.<br>Rub the leather and the rubber will produce the charge.<br>He was arrested on a charge of armed robbery.<br>The extra charge is for the water bed.<br>How much do you charge per unit?<br>The suspect was charged with murdering his wife.<br>Please charge these bills to my account.<br>He forgot to charge the battery.<br>She was charged with an important mission.|你身为组长，应当负起责任来。<br>他被指控犯武装抢劫罪而遭逮捕。<br>摩擦皮毛和橡胶会产生电荷。<br>他被指控犯武装抢劫罪而遭逮捕。<br>超额费用是因为有水床。<br>你们每件要价多少呢？<br>嫌疑犯被控诉为谋杀他的妻子。<br>请把这些帐单记在我的账上。<br>他忘记给电池充电了。<br>她被委以重任。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|chapter|英['tʃæptə(r)] 美['tʃæptər]|n.章；回；篇|One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in chapter 6.<br>He has got prepared to write a new chapter.<br>Let us revert to the earlier part of the chapter.<br>Chapter IV is about anaphora of third person pronouns.<br>He could recite the prose chapter and verse.|书中最有趣的情节是在第 6 章。<br>他已经准备动手写新的一章。<br>让我们回到本章的前面部分。<br>第四章，第三人称代词回指研究。<br>他能一字不漏地背诵那篇散文。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|chat|英[tʃæt] 美[tʃæt]|vi.闲谈；谈天<br>n.闲谈；聊天|He came round last week and we chatted for a while.<br>He likes to chat with his e-pals on the Internet.<br>It is pleasant to chat with friends, and with no chat is it more pleasant than with close friends.|上星期他顺道来访，我们闲谈了一会。<br>他喜欢上网与网友聊天。<br>和朋友聊天是愉快的，而这种情形没有比和知己的朋友聊天更为愉快。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|cheat|英[tʃiːt] 美[tʃiːt]|vt.欺骗；骗取<br>vi.作弊；行骗<br>n.骗子；欺骗|We were on our honor not to cheat the customers.<br>It is contemptible to cheat friends.<br>They cheat the old woman of her house and money.<br>I would rather fail than cheat in the examination.<br>He never cheats to pass examination.<br>It is just not credible that she would cheat.<br>He is a shameless cheat.<br>Your cheat will sooner or later find you out.|我们以名誉担保不欺骗顾客。<br>欺骗朋友是卑劣的。<br>他们骗取了老妇人的房屋和钱财。<br>我宁愿考不及格，也不愿意考试作弊。<br>他考试从不作弊。<br>她会行骗简直难以置信。<br>他是个无耻的骗子。<br>你的欺骗行为迟早会暴露的。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|cigarette|英[ˌsɪɡə'ret] 美['sɪɡəret]|n.香烟，卷烟，烟卷|He asked me if I had a cigarette lighter with me.<br>A cigarette set the dry grass alight.<br>Don't drop cigarette ash on the carpet.<br>He lit a cigarette in order to calm his mind.<br>A good cigarette will smoke at least ten minutes.<br>A cigarette thrown into the woods in dry weather may start a fire.<br>In our city, the shops were not allowed to sell cigarettes to students.|他问我身上是否带着打火机。<br>香烟把乾草点著了。<br>别把烟灰落在地毯上。<br>他点燃一支香烟，镇定一下情绪。<br>一支好烟至少可以抽 10 分钟。<br>在天气干燥时把点燃的香烟扔进树林可能会引起火灾。<br>在我市，商店不准把香烟卖给学生。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|circuit|英['sɜːkɪt] 美['sɜːrkɪt]|n.巡回；线路；环形；电路；回路<br>v.巡回；绕……环形|The commanding officer made a circuit of the camp.<br>Complete minor repairs to circuit wiring.<br>The circuit is a conventional ring counter.<br>The circuit of the city walls is three miles.<br>The rocket did one circuit of the earth and returned to base.<br>There are two breakers in this circuit.<br>The switches close the contacts and complete the circuit.<br>I hit the lunch-and-lecture circuit again.<br>Smith was subpoenaed as a witness to appear in the circuit court.<br>The circuit is a conventional ring counter.|指挥官在营地巡视一周。<br>完成线路小修。<br>此线路是一个普通的环形计数器。<br>环绕本市城墙的周长是三英里。<br>火箭绕地球运行一周后返回基地。<br>这个电路里面使用了两个断路器。<br>这些开关可使接触器接通电流形成回路。<br>我又去参加那些巡回午餐演讲了。<br>史密斯被传唤作为证人在巡回法院出庭。<br>此线路是一个普通的环形计数器。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|concrete|英['kɒŋkriːt] 美['kɑːŋkriːt]|adj.具体的；实质性的；混凝土的<br>n.水泥；混凝土；具体物<br>v.凝结；结合|I can't tell you anything concrete.<br>He had nothing concrete to fasten it upon.<br>The statue rests on a bed of concrete.<br>Between these are fixed precast concrete external cladding panels.<br>Tom tumbled over and hit his head on the concrete.<br>They have had the tunnel shored up with concrete.<br>The house is made of stone, not concrete.<br>The road was paved with concrete.<br>Beauty is not concrete but a door is.<br>The government concreted the road over.<br>Slabs are concreted complete with ducts and openings framed with metal aprons welded to slab reinforcement and intended to accommodate columns.<br>It is easier to think in concrete terms rather than in the abstract.|这具体的我也说不上来。<br>他抓不到什么具体的证据。<br>这座雕像立在混凝土的基座上。<br>在它们之间填上预制混凝土的外层空心板。<br>汤姆摔倒，头撞到水泥地。<br>他们已经叫人用水泥把坑道加固。<br>那房子是石造的，不是混凝土造的。<br>路面由混凝土铺成。<br>美丽不是具体物，但门是。<br>政府用混凝土铺路。<br>楼板用混凝土浇注成整体，其上留有用金属挡板围成的孔道和提升环，它们和楼板配筋焊接在一起，以备将柱子套入其中。<br>结合具体的事物来思考要比抽象思考容易些。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|condition|英[kən'dɪʃn] 美[kən'dɪʃn]|n.条件；情况<br>v.训练；决定；以……为条件；护理（头发）|Conditions in poor quarters were horrible.<br>I had halfway decided to accept their conditions at that time.<br>The terrorists will only release their hostage on certain condition.<br>Jimmie had but a vague idea of world conditions now.<br>His thinking is incommensurate to the changed conditions.<br>I conditioned the dog to bark at strangers.<br>Most people have been conditioned to accept what they see on television.<br>The amount of money I spend is conditioned by the amount I earn.<br>Age and health do not always condition each other.<br>The gift to the boy was conditioned on his good behavior.<br>I condition my hair every two weeks.|城里穷人居住区条件十分糟糕。<br>当时我已差不多决定要接受他们的条件了。<br>恐怖分子只有在某些条件下才释放人质。<br>杰米对当今世界情况只有一点模糊的了解。<br>他的思想和已经变化了的情况不相适应。<br>我训练这只狗对陌生人吠叫。<br>大多数人已被训练得会接受电视里看到的东西。<br>我花多少钱是由我挣多少钱决定的。<br>年龄与健康并不总是互为条件的。<br>给孩子的礼物是以他的表现好坏为条件的。<br>我每两周做一次头发。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|debt|英[det] 美[det]|n.债务；恩情；负债状态；义务；罪|He promised to pay his debt within a month.<br>If I pay all my debts I'll have no money.<br>We owe you a debt of gratitude for you help.<br>The company is deep in debt.<br>We'll run into debt if you spend more than our income.<br>You have an obligation to pay your debt to society.<br>Liabilities are the obligatio or debt that a busine must pay in money or services at some time in the future.<br>He's in debt to the extent of200.<br>They said that they would drop the charges if we paid off the debt.|他保证在 1 个月内偿还债务。<br>我若还请所有欠债就分文不剩了。<br>承蒙帮助，感恩不尽。<br>这家公司正负债累累。<br>要是你花的比我们挣的还多，我们就要欠债了。<br>你有义务偿还对社会的债务。<br>负债是指将来需用货币或服务偿还的债务或履行的义务。<br>请求为他犯的偷窃罪从轻量刑。<br>他们说还清欠款就可以顶罪了。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|dip|英[dɪp] 美[dɪp]|v.浸；蘸；下沉；倾斜；掏取；浏览<br>n.浸泡；浸；蘸；倾斜；下降|The boat dipped into the waves.<br>He dipped his pen in the ink.<br>The children like to dip their bread into the milk.<br>The sun dipped below the horizon.<br>The land dips gently to the south.<br>I've only had time to dip into the report.<br>On a hot day a dip in the sea is sheer paradise.<br>Would you like to take a dip in the pool?<br>The children like to dip their bread into the milk.<br>When you shoot an arrow of truth, dip its point in honey.<br>The road takes a dip round the corner.<br>Share prices have taken a slight dip.|小船沉没在波涛之中。<br>他拿钢笔蘸墨水。<br>孩子们喜欢把面包蘸牛奶吃。<br>太阳落到地平线下。<br>地面缓缓向南倾斜。<br>这份报告我只来得及浏览了一遍。<br>热天洗个海水澡是十分令人惬意的事。<br>你想在游泳池里小游一会儿吗？<br>孩子们喜欢把面包蘸牛奶吃。<br>射出真理的箭，先在蜜里蘸。<br>那条路在转角处往下倾斜。<br>股票价格稍微有所下降。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|divide|英[dɪ'vaɪd] 美[dɪ'vaɪd]|vt.划分；隔开；分割；[数]除<br>vi.分裂；分开<br>n.分水岭；分歧；分|White lines divide the playing area into sections.<br>I hope this disagreement will not divide us.<br>Divide the cake into equal parts.<br>Six divided by two is three.<br>Class differences can divide a nation.<br>The cancer cells divide much more rapidly than the normal cells.<br>The train divides at York.<br>This led to a divide between the upper class and the common man that persists to a degree down to the present generation.<br>There is a deep divide between the two factions.<br>The racial divide between the city and its suburbs is deepening.|这些白线把赛区分成各个部分。<br>我希望我们不会因这分歧而对立起来。<br>把蛋糕分成等份。<br>六除以二得三。<br>阶级差异会造成国家的分裂。<br>癌细胞的分裂比正常细胞快得多。<br>这列火车在约克市调动车厢分途行驶。<br>这导致上层社会和平民大众之间的隔阂，在某种程度上，这个隔阂持续到当代。<br>这两派之间有很深的分歧。<br>城区与周边地区的差异正在加深。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|drag|英[dræɡ] 美[dræɡ]|v.拖；拉；迫使；缓慢行进；进行过久；扯进；打捞<br>n.拖；拉；累赘；阻力<br>n.男子穿的女子服装|He jumped into the river and dragged her to safety.<br>She dragged herself out of bed, still half asleep.<br>She always drags behind us.<br>The first hour of the movie really dragged.<br>I don't want to drag out this argument any further.<br>She dragged up that incident just to embarrass me.<br>They dragged the canal for the missing child.<br>The cat is really excited by the drag of the basket on the floor.<br>The drag of the his son up to top of the mountain exhausted him.<br>Walking is a drag--let's take the car.<br>High interest rates are a drag on the housing market.|他跳进河里，把她拉到安全地带。<br>她挣扎着起了床，还是睡眼惺忪。<br>她总是在我们后面吃力地跟着。<br>那部电影的前一个小时真的是过得很慢。<br>我不想再就这场争论进一步拖长下去。<br>她又扯起那件事故意想使我难堪。<br>他们用拖网沿运河打捞失踪孩子的尸体。<br>在地板上来来回回拖着篮子可着实让那只猫兴奋了一回。<br>把他的儿子拉上山顶可真累坏了他。<br>走路太费事了——我们坐汽车吧。<br>高利率是住房市场上的一个阻力。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|due|英[djuː] 美[duː]|adj.应有的；到期的；预定的；应付的<br>n.应得物；会费|When it comes to giving due respect to the old people, she feels a bit uneasy.<br>If you're going to the library, would you mind returning this book for me? It's due today.<br>The English version of the novel is due for publication next year.<br>The Customer obligations to pay any due amount shall include all commissions, charges and other costs determined by the Company.<br>He received a large reward, which was no more than his due.<br>Paul haven't paid my dues yet.|说到给老人应有的尊敬，她有些不自在。<br>如果你要去图书馆的话，是否介意替我还一下这本书呢？它今天到期。<br>这部小说的英文译本预定明年出版发行。<br>客户有支付任何应付的金额的义务应包括公司规定的所有的佣金，收费及其他费用。<br>他得到了一大笔奖金，这只是他应得的。<br>保罗还没交会费。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|dull|英[dʌl] 美[dʌl]|adj.呆滞的；钝的；迟钝的；无趣的；暗的<br>v.变钝；迟钝|Jack had all work but no play, making him a dull boy.<br>It's impossible to cut a pineapple with such a dull knife.<br>The mind becomes dull if the body doesn't get on exercise.<br>This book is rather dull.<br>The dying fire was throwing out a dull red light.<br>The heating was turned up high to dull his audience's senses.<br>She gave me some medicine to dull the pain.<br>The sensory nerves of this old man seem to dull.|杰克只学不玩，这使得他成为一个呆笨的孩子。<br>用一把这么钝的刀子切菠萝是不可能的。<br>要是身体得不到锻炼，头脑也会迟钝的。<br>这本书很枯燥。<br>将要熄灭的火发出暗红色的光。<br>暖气温度被调到很高，以至于听众的意识变得迟钝。<br>她给了我一些可减轻疼痛的药。<br>这位老人的感觉神经似乎不太敏锐了。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|feeling|英['fiːlɪŋ] 美['fiːlɪŋ]|n.感觉；知觉；气氛；鉴赏力；反感<br>adj.有感情的；富于同情心的；含情脉脉的<br>（复）feelings：感情。|I have a feeling that we are being followed.<br>The feeling deepened with the passing of the years.<br>He had no movement or feeling below his navel.<br>I've lost all feeling in the left arm.<br>There is a weird feeling about the place.<br>You have no feeling for the beauty of nature.<br>His speech caused a lot of feeling.<br>His rapid promotion caused much bad feeling among his colleagues.<br>He is not a mere lump of clay but a feeling creature.|我有种感觉我们正被人跟踪。<br>这种感觉一年一年地加深了。<br>肚脐以下没有知觉，也不能活动。<br>我左臂完全失去了知觉。<br>这地方有一种神秘的气氛。<br>你对大自然的美缺乏欣赏力。<br>他的讲演引起了很多反感。<br>他获迅速提升在同事中引起很大的不满。<br>他不仅具有血肉之躯而且是一个有感情的人。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|fond|英[fɒnd] 美[fɑːnd]|adj.溺爱的；喜欢的；愚蠢的；渴望的|A fond mother may spoil her child.<br>The fond father smiled with pleasure.<br>I am not fond of solitude.<br>He was fond of drawing when he was a child.<br>He is fond of high-sounding phrases.<br>She has many shortcomings, but we're all very fond of her.<br>My little son is fond of playing practical jokes on me.<br>He has a fond belief in his own cleverness.<br>Her father is extremely rich; many fond hopes are pinned on rich uncles.<br>He had fond dreams of living on Saturn.|溺爱的母亲可能会宠坏她的孩子。<br>溺爱孩子的父亲高兴地微笑了。<br>我不喜欢孤独。<br>他还是个孩子时就喜欢画画。<br>他爱用夸大的词句。<br>虽然她有许多缺点，但我们都很喜欢她。<br>我的小儿子喜欢对我玩恶作剧。<br>他盲目相信自己的聪明。<br>他父亲非常有钱；将许多渴望寄托在有钱叔叔的身上。<br>他做着在火星上生活的黄粱美梦。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|fool|英[fuːl] 美[fuːl]|n.傻瓜；小丑；奶油果蓉<br>v.愚弄；欺骗；开玩笑；干蠢事；玩弄；鬼混|What a fool I was to believe he is a good man.<br>I am a fool to have refused the job.<br>He played the fool to entertain the king in that opera.<br>He is trying to fool you,don't listen to him.<br>He has fooled a lot of people into believing he is a rich man.<br>She fooled the old man out of all his money.<br>I was only fooling when I said I'd lost your keys.<br>Don't be angry. We are just fooling.<br>Stop fooling about with that knife or someone will get hurt.<br>Stop fooling with her affections.<br>That silly child never does anything; he just fools about all day long.<br>I was meant to be working on Sunday, but I just fooled around all day.|我竟然相信他是个好人，我真是个傻瓜。<br>我真傻，拒绝了那项工作。<br>在那部歌剧中他扮演小丑来逗国王开心。<br>他想愚弄你，别听他的。<br>他骗了许多人，让人相信他是个富翁。<br>她骗走了老人所有的钱。<br>我说把你的钥匙丢了，只是逗你玩的。<br>别生气，我们只是闹著玩的。<br>不要摆弄那把刀，会伤人的。<br>不要再玩弄她的感情了。<br>那个傻孩子从来不做事，只是整天游手好闲。<br>星期日我本应工作的，但却闲混了一整天。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|force|英[fɔːs] 美[fɔːrs]|n.武力；暴力；力量；影响力；力量大的人或（事物）；权力；（为某目的组织起来的）一群人；军队；部队；武装力量；警察部门；力；风力<br>v.迫使；强迫；强制；使发生；强装（欢笑）；人工催长|When persuasion failed they used force.<br>We'll settle the problem by force if necessary.<br>If you do not open the door, I am authorized to enter by use of force.<br>It is vain to attempt to root out heresy by force.<br>The force of his fall was broken by the straw mats.<br>The force of the explosion broke all the windows in the building.<br>The law should remain in force.<br>She is a force to be reckoned with.<br>These guidelines do not have the force of law.<br>Air force units have been ordered to intensify their patrols.<br>The armed forces usually consist of the army, the navy and the air force.<br>He joined the force twenty years ago.<br>The moon exerts a force on the earth.<br>Trees break the force of the wind.<br>Circumstances force us to adopt this policy.<br>No power on earth could force me to do it .<br>This will force a system shutdown, whether a user is logged in or not.<br>Building a new road here will force house prices down.<br>She managed to force a smile.<br>It is unwise to force a child's talent.|劝说无效时，他们就使用武力了。<br>如果有必要的话，我们会用武力解决这个问题。<br>如果你不开门，我有权使用暴力闯入。<br>试图用暴力消除异端邪说是徒劳的。<br>草垫的缓冲作用减弱了他下跌的力量。<br>爆炸的力量震碎了这座建筑上的所有窗户。<br>法律应当有效力。<br>她是一个需要认真对待的有影响力的人物。<br>这些指导原则不具有法律效力。<br>空军部队奉命加强巡逻。<br>武装力量通常有陆、海、空军组成。<br>他二十年前加入了警队。<br>月球对地球有引力。<br>树使风力减弱。<br>形势迫使我们采取这项政策。<br>世上没人能强迫我做这事。<br>这将强制关闭一个系统。无论使用者是否已经登陆。<br>在这里修建一条新道路将使房价下跌。<br>她勉强笑笑。<br>对儿童的才能拔苗助长是不明智的。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|freezing|英['friːzɪŋ] 美['friːzɪŋ]|adj.冰冻的；严寒的；冷冻用的<br>n.冰冻<br>动词 freeze 的现在分词。|Freezing weather will break up the soil.<br>Leave a basin of water outside in freezing weather.<br>Freezing winter is harmful to orange trees.<br>Freezing weather will break up the soil.|冰冻的天气使土地龟裂。<br>在冰冻的天气里，放一盆水在室外。<br>冰冻天气对桔子树是有害的。<br>冰冻的天气使土地龟裂。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|gas|英[ɡæs] 美[ɡæs]|n.煤气；气体；汽油；空话<br>vt.使吸入毒气；毒（死）；给……加汽油<br>vi.空谈；加汽油|Gas is now widely used for cooking and heating.<br>She lit the gas and gave the coffee another warm.<br>Hydrogen and oxygen are gases.<br>Air is a mixture of gases.<br>I'll refill my cigarette lighter with gas.<br>He ran out of gas a mile from home.<br>His long speech was nothing but gas and hot air.<br>He was badly gassed in the war.<br>She couldn't face the future, and gassed herself.<br>The girls were still gassing when I left.|现在普遍用煤气烧饭和取暖。<br>她点燃煤气，把咖啡重新热了一下。<br>氢和氧是气体。<br>空气是气体的混合物。<br>我将给打火机再灌满汽油。<br>他在离家还有一英里的地方把汽油用完了。<br>他的长篇大论只是吹牛和空话。<br>他在战争中深受毒气伤害。<br>她对未来感到绝望，用煤气自杀了。<br>我走的时候，那些女孩子们还在胡扯。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|hopeless|英['həʊpləs] 美['hoʊpləs]|adj.没有希望的；绝望的；无可救药的|Things are so difficult that it seems hopeless.<br>The doctor said the old man's condition was hopeless.<br>You look on this adventure over here as hopeless.<br>It functions as a sort of mid-life purgatory for hopeless souls on Earth.<br>Mido was hopeless and will surely be on his way.|事情是这样的困难，宪政是没有希望的了。<br>医生说这位老人的病是没有希望的了。<br>你对这儿的投机事业认为是绝望的。<br>它的职能作为一种中年炼狱为无可救药的灵魂在地球上。<br>米多是无药可救了，肯定会离开的。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|horrible|英['hɒrəbl] 美['hɔːrəbl]|adj.可怕的；令人毛骨悚然的；令人讨厌的|His heart sickened at the thought of that horrible scene.<br>Everything is in a horrible muddle.<br>The sight of the battlefield was horrible.<br>Dense fog is always horrible to the driver.<br>Will you stop making that horrible noise!|他一想到那种可怕的情景就感到恶心。<br>一切都陷入可怕的混乱。<br>战场的情景令人毛骨悚然。<br>对于路上的司机浓雾总是很讨厌的。<br>你别再弄出那种讨厌的响声来行不行。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|impress|英[ɪm'pres] 美[ɪm'pres]|n.印记；印象；特征<br>v.使……有印象；影响；印刻；传送|Their honesty and hospitality leave an indelible impress on her life.<br>I had a chance to impress her with my efficiency and I muffed it up.<br>She impressed me as a scholar.<br>What impress you most when you go to IKEA?<br>How these mergers impress Chinese beer industry is the point of this paper.<br>If you are unable to sign, please impress your left thumbprint.<br>You must impress your seal on this official letter.|他们的诚实与好客给她一生留下了难以磨灭的印象。<br>我本来有机会使她对我的办事效率有印象，但是我错过了这个机会。<br>她给我留下了学者的印象。<br>您去宜家时以下哪一项对您影响最深刻？<br>这些并购对啤酒业绩效的影响是本文讨论的中心问题。<br>如不能签署，请印下左拇指指模。<br>你必须在这份公函上盖上你的。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|impression|英[ɪm'preʃn] 美[ɪm'preʃn]|n.印象；感觉；模仿<br>n.印迹；印刷|Her gentleness has given me a deep impression.<br>I am surprised you've got an unfavorable impression of him.<br>I had the impression that your boy hates school.<br>The students did some marvellous impressions of the teachers at the end-of-term party.<br>The first edition of this dictionary has an impression of 10,000 copies and the total price is 1,000,000 yuan.|她的亲切给我留下了很深的印象。<br>我很惊讶你对他印象不佳。<br>我感觉你的孩子不喜欢去上学。<br>在期末联欢会上，学生惟妙惟肖地模仿起了教师。<br>这部词典第一版印刷一万册，码洋为一百万元。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|jar|英[dʒɑː(r)] 美[dʒɑːr]|n.广口瓶；坛子；刺耳声；震动<br>vi.发刺耳声；不协调；震荡；冲突<br>vt.扰乱；震动|I can't get the lid off this jar.<br>The jar contains ten glasses of water.<br>I need a jar to make the krauts.<br>He fashioned the clay into a jar.<br>The jar of the alarm woke me up.<br>The side of the boat hit the reef with a grinding jar.<br>The jar of the explosion was felt for miles around.<br>The iron gate jarred when he opened it.<br>His harsh criticism jarred with the friendly tone of the meeting.<br>The orange curtains jar with the red furniture.<br>The noise is beginning to jar on my nerves.<br>Their opinion jarred with ours.<br>The children's screams jar my nerves.<br>The decision will jar the country.|我打不开这广口瓶的盖子。<br>这只大口瓶能装十杯水。<br>我需要一个坛子做泡菜。<br>他用粘土做成一个陶土罐子。<br>闹钟的刺耳铃声把我吵醒了。<br>船撞到礁石发出刺耳的声音。<br>那次爆炸引起的震荡周围好几英里都能感觉到。<br>他开门时，铁门发出刺耳的嘎嘎声。<br>他批评得十分尖刻，与会议中的友好气氛很不协调。<br>这橙色窗帘与红色的家具不协调。<br>那部收音机，吵得我心神不安。<br>他们的意见与我们不一致。<br>孩子们的尖叫声使我神经不安。<br>这项决定将震动这个国家。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|labour|英['leɪbə(r)] 美['leɪbər]|n.劳动；劳工；分娩<br>v.努力；干苦力活；困难吃力地行进；反复说明<br>Labour<br>n.（英国）工党|Labour is not only a necessity but also a pleasure.<br>It takes a lot of labour to build a railway.<br>The labour question must come to the fore next session.<br>She was in labour for three hours.<br>He was elected to the leadership of the Labour Party.<br>We labour for the happiness of mankind.<br>The editor laboured over the manuscript till early morning.<br>Miners labour in the bowels of earth.<br>The old man laboured up the hillside.<br>The horses laboured up the steep slope.<br>There is no need to labour the argument.<br>You needn't labour a point that is perfectly plain.|劳动不仅是人生所必需的，而且是一种乐趣。<br>修筑一条铁路要花费许多劳动力。<br>劳工问题必将成为下届会议的热门话题。<br>她的分娩过程长达三小时。<br>他被选为工党的领导人。<br>我们为人类的幸福而努力。<br>编辑煞费苦心地修改稿件，一直干到清晨。<br>矿工们在地底下劳动。<br>老人吃力地登上山腰。<br>那些马费力地爬上了陡坡。<br>该论据无需详细说明或讨论。<br>这点很明显，你用不着讲个没完。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|loose|英[luːs] 美[luːs]|adj.松的；宽松的；不确切的；不牢固的；放纵的<br>n.解放；放任；放纵<br>v.弄松；释放；放枪<br>adv.松散地|The screw worked itself loose and the door fell off the cupboard.<br>She wore loose garments in the summer.<br>Loose labour regulations are one reason.<br>It is used these days in a very loose sense by a great many people.<br>She was branded a loose woman.<br>This will ship to our customer via their consolidator as loose freight.<br>Shake yourself loose from the accreted layers of presuppositions and assumptions that your profession has built up around the topic.<br>I still think a lot about transportation -- you never loose a dream, it just incubates as a hobby.<br>But if we leave, we loose it and I can't make an entire life disappear to start a new one.<br>Things were not just lax, but loose, as though everyone but him had grown to accept the situation.<br>Please help me loose the nail, It is rusty and won't come out of the wall.<br>A chemical change has to take place before the energy can be let loose.<br>Men were loosing off at shadows.|螺丝松了，门从橱柜上掉下来了。<br>她在夏天穿宽松的衣服。<br>宽松的劳动规则是原因之一。<br>现在，许多人用起它来是很不确切的。<br>她被标为放纵的女人。<br>这将会经由他们的整合者对我们的客户运送如解放船货。<br>把自己从本专业对此所建立的厚厚预设和假定中解放出来。<br>我直到现在还想着很多有关交通的问题，你不要放任梦想，而要把它当作一种习惯去培育。<br>可是如果我们走了，我们放纵它，我不能结束自己完整的生活去开始一段新的生活。<br>这里的事物已不能说是松懈，应该拿放纵来形容，好像除了他以外，每个人都渐渐接受了这个处境。<br>请帮我把这个钉子弄松，它生锈了，拔不出来。<br>能量释放，必须有化学变化。<br>士兵向黑影射击。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|maximum|英['mæksɪməm] 美['mæksɪməm]|n.最大量；最大限度；最高点<br>adj.最高的；最大极限的|This hall holds a maximum of seventy people.<br>The child turned the volume up to the maximum.<br>It is the maximum the insurance company will pay.<br>Our goal is to achieve the maximum of efficiency.<br>The maximum price we can pay is 50 pence per yard.<br>The maximum temperature in July may be 36 Celsius degree.<br>The maximum load for this lorry is one ton.<br>The dress is carefully styled for maximum comfort.<br>The demonstration was carefully orchestrated to attract maximum publicity.|这厅最多容纳七十人。<br>小孩把音量转到了最大。<br>这是保险公司所能付给的最大金额。<br>我们的目标是取得最高的效率。<br>我们所能出的最高价格是每码 50 便士。<br>七月份最高温度可能达到 36 摄氏度。<br>这辆卡车最大载重量是一吨。<br>这服装精心设计，力求达到最大限度的舒适。<br>该示威经过精心策划以尽量吸引公众注意。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|might|英[maɪt] 美[maɪt]|aux.可能；也许；may 的过去式<br>n.威力；力量|That might be in your favor.<br>You might do me a favor?<br>If someone had been with him, he might not have been drowned.<br>The boy might have known the truth, but I am not quite sure.<br>We fear the military might of the enemy.<br>To be frank, this mission is beyond my might.<br>He fought back with all his might.|那可能对你有利。<br>你或许能帮我——个忙吧？<br>如果有人在他旁边，或许他就不会溺死。<br>这男孩当时也许知道真相，但我不很确定。<br>我们惧怕敌人强大的军事力量。<br>说实话，这一使命非我能力所及。<br>他倾全力反击。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|mile|英[maɪl] 美[maɪl]|n.英里；海里；一英里赛跑|My son hoofs a mile to school each day.<br>It's not less than a mile to the station.<br>He had come up from deep down in the water as the dark cloud of blood had settled and dispersed in the mile deep sea.<br>He wants to better his record for running the mile.|我的儿子每天步行一英里去上学。<br>到火车站至少有一英里路。<br>鱼深暗色的血在一哩深的海里，像云朵般地扩散开来，鲨鱼闻到血腥味便由深水中游过来。<br>他要提高一英里赛跑的纪录。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|pace|英[peɪs] 美[peɪs]|n.速度；步伐；（一）步<br>v.踱步；（用步）测；（马）溜蹄走<br>prep.用在人名前（礼貌的表达不同意见）|She works so fast that I can't keep pace with her.<br>When John found he was going to be late, he stepped up his pace.<br>They pace in sleek chivalric certainty.<br>The trot is a pace of the horse.<br>The lion paced the floor of his cage restlessly.<br>He gets up,and begin to pace up and down the room.<br>I pace the path and I know how long it is.|她工作得很快，我跟不上她的速度。<br>约翰发现要迟到了，就加大步伐。<br>自信的步态骑士般孔武而自如。<br>快步是马行的一种步态。<br>狮子烦躁地在兽笼里走来走去。<br>他起身并开始在房间里踱来踱去。<br>我用步子量过这条路，我知道它有多长。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|Pacific|英[pə'sɪfɪk] 美[pə'sɪfɪk]|adj.温和的；和平的；和解的<br>Pacific.<br>n.太平洋<br>adj.太平洋的|The night was pacific.<br>He developed a pacific disposition in his childhood.<br>The result of this pacific policy was that no troops were called up.<br>They have pacific intentions.<br>These creatures live in the depth of the Pacific Ocean.<br>The spacecraft splashed down in the Pacific.<br>They must think you are a madman if you tell them you want to cross the Pacific on a raft.|黑夜静悄悄的。<br>童年时他养成了温和的性情。<br>这项和平政策的结果是不调集任何军队。<br>他们有和解的意向。<br>这些生物生活在太平洋的海底。<br>那艘宇宙飞船溅落在太平洋中。<br>如果你告诉他们你要乘木筏横渡太平洋，他们一定会认为你是个疯子。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|paint|英[peɪnt] 美[peɪnt]|v.油漆；绘画<br>n.油漆；颜料；绘画作品|I personally think we should paint the wall yellow.<br>They painted a coat of paint to prevent the oxidation of the ship by seawater.<br>She learns to paint in the fashion of Picasso.<br>I suggest you paint on wood instead of paper.<br>He likes to paint abstract designs on the walls.<br>The wall requires a new coat of paint.<br>Keep away from it. Don't you see the notice "Wet Paint"?<br>The artist brought his paints with him.<br>It is a great piece of paint.|我个人认为墙壁应该粉刷成黄色。<br>他们刷了一层油漆以防止船只被海水氧化。<br>她学着以毕加索的手法（绘画风格）绘画。<br>我建议你在木头上画而不是在纸上画。<br>他喜欢在墙上画抽象图案。<br>这墙需要再涂一层新油漆。<br>离远点。你没看见牌子上写著「油漆未乾」吗？<br>那画家自带颜料。<br>这是一幅绘画杰作。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|pale|英[peɪl] 美[peɪl]|adj.苍白的；灰白的；暗淡的；无力的<br>vi.变苍白；变黯淡；相形见绌<br>n.栅栏|She was pale with fear.<br>His pale face has shown his bad health.<br>The pale eyes seemed to glare past her, the eyebrows frowned, the long jaw hardened.<br>This pale child of the Parisian faubourgs livesdevelops, makes connections, "grows supple" in suffering, in the presence of social realitiesof human things, a thoughtful witness.<br>His hair was pale and lightless.<br>When he returned, he looked pale and weary.<br>She paled with shock at the news.<br>She paled at the sight of the blood.<br>The clouds paled and pulled apart.<br>The devastating floods of two years ago pale in comparison to last week's storms.<br>Her problems paled into insignificance when compared with this family's tragedy.|她吓得脸色发白。<br>他面色苍白，说明他身体不好。<br>那双灰白的眼睛仿佛看穿了她的身子，眉头皱着，长下巴发僵。<br>巴黎近郊的脸色灰白的孩子，面对着令人深省的社会现实和人间事物，活着，成长着，在苦难中沉下去，浮上来。<br>他的头发灰暗没有光泽。<br>当他回来的时候，他看上去脸色困乏无力。<br>她听到那消息大惊失色。<br>她一看到血就脸色苍白。<br>云层变淡，渐渐疏散。<br>比起上个礼拜的的暴风雨，两年前的连绵的洪水就逊色多了。<br>她问题相比起这个大家庭的悲剧就微不足道了。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|parallel|英['pærəlel] 美['pærəlel]|adj.平行的；相同的；类似的；并联的<br>n.对比；平行线（面）；双杠；相似物<br>vt.相比；相应；与……平行|In the parallel world, there might be an answer for everything.<br>Parallel processing is the most important peculiarity in this design.<br>The railway lines run parallel to the road.<br>My experience in this matter is parallel to yours.<br>My experience in selling is parallel to yours.<br>Japan's macroeconomic puzzle has a microeconomic parallel.<br>Elements may be connected in parallel, series, or any combination thereof.<br>It is inappropriate to draw such a parallel.<br>The trees stand in parallel with the road.<br>The gymnast swung on the parallel bars.<br>The accuracy of the parallel increased.<br>No one can parallel him in Math.<br>Actually no one can parallel him in poetry.<br>Her experiences parallel mine in many instances.<br>They parallel with one another.|在平行世界里，似乎有一切的答案。<br>其中，并行化的设计理念是该设计的最大特点。<br>铁路线和那条道路平行。<br>在这件事情上，我的经验和你的类似。<br>在销售方面，我的经验和你相仿。<br>日本的宏观经济难题是与其微观经济并联的。<br>这些硅碳棒可以是并联的，串连的，或者是串并混联的。<br>这种比拟是不恰当的。<br>这些树与公路平行。<br>体操运动员在双杠上摆动身子。<br>这种比拟变得愈来愈确切了。<br>在数学方面无人能与他匹敌。<br>实际上，在诗歌方面无人能同他相提并论。<br>她的经历多与我的相似。<br>他们相互平行。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|parcel|英['pɑːsl] 美['pɑːrsl]|n.包裹；部分；一块（土地）<br>vt.分配；打包|He snipped the string and untied the parcel.<br>He tied the parcel with twine.<br>Her stinginess is part and parcel of her nature.<br>Once you've explored a bit, perhaps you'll find a perfect parcel of land to build your house or business.<br>On the other hand, the opportunity cost of using land in a particular project cannot exceed the cost of buying an equivalent parcel to replace it.<br>He used to parcel out jobs to representatives.<br>He parceled up the books.|他剪断绳子，解开包裹。<br>他用细绳来捆扎包裹。<br>她生性吝啬。<br>一旦你开始探险，你可能会找到一块理想的土地去建造你的房子或者发展你的商业。<br>另外一方面，在一个特定项目中使用土地的机会成本不能超过购买一块等效的土地来替代它的成本。<br>他曾将工作分配各个代表。<br>他把书打成了包。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|passage|英['pæsɪdʒ] 美['pæsɪdʒ]|n.通过；通道；走廊；（文章等的）段落；（时间的）消逝|The bridge is not strong enough to allow the passage of vehicles.<br>The police kept a clear passage for the traffic.<br>We discovered a secret passage behind the wall.<br>This is our room, and yours is down the passage.<br>This passage may be given several interpretations.<br>He's had a rough passage since his son's death, with one illness after another.|这座桥不够牢固，车辆不能通行。<br>警方使来往车辆畅通无阻。<br>我们在墙后发现了一个秘密通道。<br>这是我们的房间，你们的在走廊的那一头。<br>这段文字可以有不同的解释。<br>自打他儿子死后他的日子过得很艰苦，病了一场又一场。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|passive|英['pæsɪv] 美['pæsɪv]|adj.被动的；消极的<br>n.被动性|He played a passive role in the marriage.<br>You are passive when you allow things to happen, but do nothing.<br>Good is the passive that obeys reason.<br>Passive tear suctioning force can be demonstrated by a Venturi tube model.|他在婚姻中扮演了一个被动的角色。<br>当你让这些事发生，而不做任何事来阻止它，你是消极的。<br>善是服从理智的被动性。<br>被动性泪液吸引之力量，可藉由文氏管模型来解释。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|patent|英['pætnt] 美['pætnt]|n.专利；特许<br>vt.给予专利权<br>adj.专利的；显著的|The patent runs out in three years time.<br>He got a patent for this invention.<br>The government patented the device to its inventor.<br>This is a packet of a patent cement mix.<br>This is a fact patent to the world.<br>It was patent to everyone that he disliked the idea.|这项专利期限为 3 年。<br>他获得了这项发明的专利权。<br>政府给予发明者专利权。<br>这是一包专利水泥混合料。<br>这是全世界都明白的事实。<br>每个人都看得出来他不喜欢这个主意。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|patience|英['peɪʃns] 美['peɪʃns]|n.耐心；忍耐；毅力|Her endless patience made her the best nurse in the hospital.<br>His patience was worn out by all these troubles.<br>She owes her success to hard work and patience.<br>His rudeness was beyond my patience.<br>Learning to walk again after his accident required great patience.|无限的耐心使她成为这个医院最好的护士。<br>这么多麻烦使他都没有耐心了。<br>她的成功是努力工作和耐心的结果。<br>他的粗暴使我无法忍受。<br>他出事后重新学习走路要有极大的毅力。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|pattern|英['pætn] 美['pætərn]|n.模式；图案；典范；式样<br>v.以图案装饰；仿造；模仿|The two buildings are modeled after the same pattern.<br>Training and education follow different patterns in different regions.<br>This cloth has a pattern of blue and white squares.<br>Threads of different colors and textures were woven into an intricate pattern.<br>She is a pattern of virtue.<br>This company set a pattern of what a good company should be.<br>Please cut out my overcoat according to this pattern.<br>I like the carpets patterned with peonies.<br>He patterned himself upon a man he admired.<br>This is a new approach patterned on Japanese ideas.|这两座建筑是按照同一模式建造的。<br>培训和教育在不同的地区遵循不同的模式。<br>这种布有蓝白格子的图案。<br>各种花色和质地的线织成了一幅复杂的图案。<br>她是美德的典范。<br>这家公司是好公司的典范。<br>我这件大衣请你照这个式样裁剪。<br>我喜欢印有牡丹花图案的地毯。<br>他模仿一位他钦佩的人。<br>这是模仿日本概念而设计的新方法。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|phrase|英[freɪz] 美[freɪz]|n.短语；习语；措辞；[音]乐句<br>vt.措词；将（乐曲）分成乐句|The new phrase is now on the tongue of men.<br>The teacher dictated the phrase to the class.<br>He hashed a phrase in order to colour the sentence.<br>The speaker certainly knew how to turn a phrase.<br>Four whipping bars, ff as well as marcatissimo, put a more or less vicious and peremptory end to the phrase.<br>Notice syncopation in the second phrase where the accent falls after the first beat.<br>She will phrase a fugue of Bach's in these days.|这个新短语现在正十分流行。<br>老师让全班同学听写这个短语。<br>他反复推敲一个习语以使该句增色。<br>该讲话者当然懂得如何措辞。<br>四个鞭打般的小节，以带强调的最强音给乐句一个或多或少野蛮而断然的结束。<br>注意第二乐句中的切分音，重音在第一拍之后出现。<br>这几天她将把巴赫的赋格曲分成旋律分句。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|physical|英['fɪzɪkl] 美['fɪzɪkl]|adj.物质的；身体的；体力的；物理的；肉体上的，身体上的<br><美>体格检查|It's a physical impossibility to be in two places at one time.<br>Physical disability causes mental anguish.<br>Staying up late makes him at his worst in terms of physical situation.<br>For them, getting rid of heavy physical labour is a big thing|同时在两地是自然规律上不可能的事。<br>生理伤残会引起心理苦闷。<br>熬夜使得他的体力状况处于低潮。<br>对他们来说，摆脱重体力劳动是一件大事。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|poison|英['pɔɪzn] 美['pɔɪzn]|n.毒药；毒害；败坏道德之事<br>vt.毒害；摧毁；中毒<br>adj.有毒的；危险的|We detected traces of the poison in her food.<br>He tried to kill himself by taking poison.<br>Some people say that selfishness is a poison in our society.<br>Someone tried to poison our dog.<br>Spiritual rubbish can poison the children's pure minds.<br>Drugs poison a person's joy in life.<br>Tainted food can poison your system.<br>Nonetheless, an Argentine pathologist who has studied diethylene glycol poisonings helped develop a test for the poison in exhumed bodies.<br>Just as a trader with a small escort and great wealth would avoid a perilous route, or just as one desiring to live avoids poison, even so should one shun evil.|我们在她的食物里发现了微量毒药。<br>他曾试图服毒自杀。<br>有些人说自私是我们社会的一害。<br>有人想毒杀我们的狗。<br>精神垃圾能毒害孩子们的纯洁心灵。<br>麻药危害人生的欢乐。<br>腐坏的食物会使身体中毒。<br>尽管如此，来自于阿根廷的病原学家仍然在掘出的尸体中检测出有毒的甘油。<br>如财多而随从少的富商避开危险的路线，如想要生存之人避免毒药，人们亦应避免邪恶。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|pulse|英[pʌls] 美[pʌls]|n.脉搏；脉冲；[植]豆类<br>v.搏动；跳动|His pulse is not very regular.<br>The excitement quickened my pulse.<br>I could feel a fluttering pulse.<br>The machine emits sound pulses.<br>I could feel blood pulsing through my veins.<br>He is now used to the life pulsing through a great city<br>His heart began to pulse faster.|他的脉搏不很规则。<br>激动使我的心跳加快。<br>我感到脉搏跳动。<br>这台机器可发出声脉冲信号。<br>我感到浑身血液在沸腾。<br>他现在习惯了大都市里紧张繁忙的生活。<br>他的心开始加快地跳动起来。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|pump|英[pʌmp] 美[pʌmp]|n.泵；抽水机；打气筒；抽水；打气<br>v.打气；唧筒般运动；灌输；抽取；增加；<口>盘问|The heart has acted as a strong pump.<br>At the farm there was an old-fashioned pump for drawing water from a well.<br>Can you lend me your bicycle pump?<br>After several pumps, the water began to flow.<br>She blow up the flat tyre with a bicycle pump.<br>Pump the tire up hard before going out on the road.<br>His heart was pumping fast.<br>It's hard work to pump facts into unwilling students.<br>It is autumn and they are pumping water out of the swimming pool.<br>They have cut prices in an attempt to pump up sales.|心脏充当了一部强有力的泵。<br>那个农场有一台老式的用来从井里抽水的抽水机。<br>能把你的打气筒借给我吗？<br>用泵抽了几下之后，水流出来了。<br>她用自行车打气筒给瘪了的轮胎打气。<br>在出去上路之前，要把轮胎打足气。<br>他的心脏跳动得很快。<br>向不自觉的学生灌输知识并非易事。<br>入秋了，他们正在抽游泳池的水。<br>为了增加销售量他们减价销售。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|random|英['rændəm] 美['rændəm]|adj.任意的；随机的；随意的<br>n.随意；任意<br>adv.随机地|Men are exposed to more acts of random physical violence.<br>Most people know that the outcome of a coin toss is random.<br>The computer will generate apparently random numbers.<br>This random approach is not as dubious as one might expect.<br>Soiled dishes were piled at random.<br>The librarian took a book at random from the shelf.<br>These fluctuations are random in nature.<br>This paper proposes a method of interference suppression for a random planar array.<br>Complex organs made up of separate but necessary subsystems cannot be the result of random chance.|男人受到更多的任意的身体强烈活动。<br>大部分人都知道掷硬币的结果是随机的。<br>电脑似乎将随机产生号码。<br>这种随意的途径并不象人们所预期的那样无把握。<br>脏碟子胡乱地堆放着。<br>图书管理员从书架上随便拿了一本书。<br>这种波动的性质是任意随机的。<br>本文提出一种任意平面阵列抑制干扰的方法。<br>复杂的器官是由独立的，必要的子系统组成，而且不能随机地形成。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|range|英[reɪndʒ] 美[reɪndʒ]|n.范围；射程；山脉；排；一系列；闲逛；炉灶；【数】值域，极差<br>v.排列；使…站在某一方；延伸；漫游；射程达到（某距离）|The houses are sold out within this price range.<br>It has come within the range of practical politics.<br>He used a whistle to decoy the birds within range.<br>She is still within range of my gun.<br>A range of hills rose on our left.<br>Name one large mountain range in the United States.<br>There is a fine range here in this book.<br>Here we have a range of products, our toys.<br>She takes her dog for a range every afternoon.<br>Gas is escaping from the range.<br>The shabby houses used to range along the road.<br>The spectators ranged themselves along the route of the procession.<br>On this issue, she has ranged herself with the Opposition.<br>The children's ages range from 8 to 15.<br>Our conversation ranged over many topics.<br>We ranged the woods looking for a place to set up our tents.<br>This rifle ranges over a mile.|在这个价位范围之内的房子已售完。<br>这就属于可实施性政治的范围了。<br>他用口哨把鸟群诱至射程内。<br>她仍在我枪炮的射程之内。<br>山脉在我们左方出现。<br>说出美国其中一个大山脉。<br>这本小册子里记有一系列上等货。<br>我们这儿有一系列的产品，我们的玩具。<br>她每天下午牵着狗闲逛。<br>瓦斯从瓦斯炉灶漏出。<br>过去这路边破败的房子排成行。<br>观众沿游行队伍的路线列队停立。<br>在这个问题上，她站在反对派一边。<br>这些孩子们的年龄在 8 岁到 15 岁之间。<br>我们的谈话涉及很多话题。<br>我们在树林里东走西跑，找个地方搭帐篷。<br>这种步枪射程达一英里。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|reject|英['riːdʒekt] 美['riːdʒekt]|vt.拒绝；排斥；驳回；丢弃<br>n.不合格产品；被拒之人|He rejected their offer of a job.<br>After the transplant his body rejected the new heart.<br>The supermarket rejected all spotted apples.<br>The factory sells some of its better rejects cheaply, but it throws most of the rejects away.<br>He was a reject from the varsity team.|他拒绝了他们给他的工作。<br>他的身体对新移植的心脏产生了排斥作用。<br>超级市场丢弃了所有的烂苹果。<br>这家公司廉价出售略好一些的次品，但将大多数次品丢弃。<br>他被大学代表队拒绝了。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|relation|英[rɪ'leɪʃn] 美[rɪ'leɪʃn]|n.关系；联系；亲戚；陈述；参考|Relation between the two countries has reached a crisis point.<br>We try to maintain good relation with our customer.<br>We wish to establish relation with you.<br>I don't see any relation between the two problems.<br>The relation between unemployment and inflation has also weakened.<br>He is a near relation of mine.<br>You may invite all your relations to the dinner party.<br>A distant relation of hers came to see her yesterday.<br>His relation of his adventure fascinated us.<br>Her own relation gives us a remarkably objective account of her final attempt.<br>Several referenced suggestions in relation to the sustainable development of Chinese professional football were preposed.|两国关系已达到出现危机的地步。<br>我们努力与客户保持良好的关系。<br>我们希望与你们建立贸易关系。<br>我看不出这两个问题间的联系。<br>失业和通胀之间的联系也被削弱了。<br>他是我的一个近亲。<br>你可以请你所有的亲戚来参加晚宴。<br>昨天她的一个远方亲戚来看她。<br>他讲述的关于自己的冒险经历使我们听入了迷。<br>他的叙述地为我们客观地描绘了她的最后一次尝试。<br>从而对中国职业足球的持续发展提出参考意见。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|require|英[rɪ'kwaɪə(r)] 美[rɪ'kwaɪər]|v.要求；需要；命令；规定|The director required that we should work all night.<br>We must not propagate one method and require all localities to adopt it.<br>Please call if you require assistance.<br>This game requires a minimum of three players.<br>The headmaster required her to keep silent.<br>Napoleon required every soldier to obey his orders.<br>Students are required to attend classes.<br>As required by the traceablitiy, the duplicate copy of purchase documents shall be kept.|主任要求我们通宵工作。<br>我们在宣传上不要只讲一种办法，要求各地都照着去做。<br>如果需要帮忙，请打电话。<br>这个游戏至少需要三个人才可以玩。<br>校长命令她不要做声。<br>拿破仑要求每个士兵都服从他的命令。<br>学生必须按规定上课<br>根据可追溯性的专用要求的范围规定，应保存有关采购文件的副本。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|rescue|英['reskjuː] 美['reskjuː]|vt.营救；援救<br>n.营救；救援|He dived from the bridge to rescue the drowning child.<br>Had Jim not dived in to rescue him, the boy would have drowned.<br>The government has rescued the firm from bankruptcy by giving them a grant.<br>The rescue attempt was impeded by bad weather.<br>Rescue workers rushed to the site of the plane crash.|他从桥上跳入水中去抢救那溺水儿童。<br>如果不是吉姆跳下水去救，那小孩早就淹死了。<br>政府拨款给这家公司使其免于破产。<br>营救工作受到恶劣天气的妨碍。<br>抢救人员冲向飞机坠毁的现场。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|reserve|英[rɪ'zɜːv] 美[rɪ'zɜːrv]|vt.保留；预订；延期<br>n.候补；预备品；贮存<br>n.含蓄；克制|We reserve the right to lodge a claim for loss.<br>I have reserved a table at the restaurant.<br>The court will reserve judgement.<br>He has played very well on the reserve side but this chance in the first team should put him on his mettle.<br>The army should be equipped with sufficient war reserves.<br>The old man keeps a large reserve of firewood for cold weather.<br>The ultimate reserve was a source of his fascination and his power.|我们保留要求赔偿损失的权利。<br>我已在饭店预订了一桌菜。<br>法庭将延期判决。<br>他在候补队中表现非常出色，但这次作为正式队员参赛将对他的能力进行考验。<br>军队应该得到充足的军需储备品。<br>这位老人贮存了大量的柴薪以备天冷时用。<br>最大限度的克制是他获得魅力和力量的一个源泉。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|respect|英[rɪ'spekt] 美[rɪ'spekt]|vt.尊敬；尊重；遵守；关于；涉及<br>n.尊敬；敬重；关系；方面<br>n.（复）respects：敬意；问候|All students should respect their teachers.<br>I respected their moral standards.<br>I respect him as a writer and as a man.<br>We must respect the laws of a country we are in.<br>Respecting your salary, we shall come to a decision.<br>The terms of the agreement respect the boundary line between the two countries.<br>The students have great respect for their history teacher.<br>They treated me with respect.<br>Their relationship was based on mutual respect.<br>Respect and friendship provide a solid foundation for marriage.<br>It's going to raise a lot of problems with respect to atmosphere pollution.<br>My argument is different from yours in one crucial respect.<br>We called to pay our respects.<br>Please give my respects to your parents.|凡是学生就应当尊敬老师。<br>我尊重他们的道德标准。<br>我尊重他这位作家，也尊重他这个人。<br>我们必须遵守所在国家的法律。<br>关于你的薪水，我们稍后会做出决定。<br>协议的条款涉及两国间的边界线。<br>学生们非常尊敬他们的历史老师。<br>他们对我很敬重。<br>他们的关系是以相互的尊重为基础的。<br>尊重和伴侣关系是婚姻的牢固基础。<br>这将会引起许多有关环境污染方面的问题。<br>我的论点在一个至关重要的方面跟你的不一样。<br>我们去拜望了，以表示敬意<br>请向你父母表达我的问候。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|rise|英[raɪz] 美[raɪz]|vi.上升；升起；增加；起床；反抗；复活<br>n.上升；增加；斜坡；小山|The higher we rise, the smaller we appear to those who do not know how to fly.<br>The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.<br>In proportion as the sales increase the profit will rise.<br>The next morning I was the first to rise.<br>The king's cruelty excited the people to rise against him.<br>Christians believe that Jesus rose from the dead on Easter Sunday.<br>I am reading a book about the rise and fall of the Roman Empire.<br>Experts say the figures for divorce are on the rise.<br>Tax revenue reached 1,637.1 billion yuan, a rise of 240 billion yuan in comparable terms.<br>The length of the steps depends on the rise of the slope.<br>On mountain slopes that receive plentiful rainfall, huge Douglas firs rise in towering columns.|我们上升得越高，我们在那些不懂飞翔的人眼里就显得越遥远。<br>太阳从东方升起，在西方落下。<br>随着销售量增长，利润也成比例地增加。<br>第二天早上，我是第一个起床的。<br>那个国王的残酷激起了人民起来反对他。<br>基督徒相信耶稣在那个星期日（後定为复活节）里复活了。<br>我正在看一本关于罗马帝国兴衰的书。<br>专家称，离婚数量在增加。<br>税收大幅度增长，全国财政收入达到 16371 亿元，按可比口径增加 2400 亿元。<br>台阶的长度远取决于斜坡的倾斜度。<br>在有充足降水的斜坡，巨大的道格拉斯枞树高耸入云。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|sacrifice|英['sækrɪfaɪs] 美['sækrɪfaɪs]|n.牺牲；祭品；供奉<br>vt.牺牲；亏本出售；供奉<br>vi.献祭；（棒球）作牺牲一击|He gave his life as a sacrifice for his country.<br>She made a big sacrifice for her position today.<br>A calf was offered up as a sacrifice to the goddess.<br>In the first scene, I sacrifice a sheep, taking its heart.<br>You must not sacrifice studies for pleasure.<br>It's the company's policy to sacrifice short-term profits for the sake of long-term growth.<br>He sacrificed his car when he go abroad to work.<br>The high priest sacrificed the goat on the altar.<br>Sacrifice is the ultimate act of self-giving love.<br>I have come to sacrifice to Jehovah.<br>As an additional cost to play Shard Volley, sacrifice a land.|他为国牺牲了。<br>她为今天的职位付出了很大的代价。<br>向女神祭献了一头牺牲小牛。<br>第一幕场景中，我供奉了一只羊，取出了它的心脏。<br>你不能为享乐而牺牲学业。<br>为长期发展而牺牲短期利润是公司的方针。<br>他到海外去工作的时候亏本出售了他的汽车。<br>大祭司把山羊供奉在祭坛上。<br>献祭却是最舍己的爱的行动。<br>我来是要向耶和华献祭。<br>作为碎片齐发的额外费用，牺牲一快地。|高中英语单词

He had lost his senses.<br>Don't act so foolishly, John. Come to your senses.<br>There is no sense in waiting three hours.<br>There is a lot of sense in what she has said.<br>The horse sensed danger and stopped.<br>Lisa sensed that he did not believe her.<br>Can you sense the essence of this poem?<br>The apparatus can sense the presence of toxic gases.|我丧失了味觉。<br>恐怕我的方位感很差，因此我容易迷路。<br>他感到非常失落。<br>你兄弟很有幽默感。<br>学者往往缺乏冷静地辨别轻重缓急的能力。<br>这个词的意义不明确。<br>这部小说的含义是人类悲剧的不可避免性。<br>别放在心上。他是失去理智了。<br>别丑态百出啦，约翰，放理智点。<br>等三个小时是不合理的。<br>她说的话很有见地。<br>马感觉到了危险，于是停了下来。<br>莉萨意识到他不相信她。<br>你能理解这首诗的精华吗？<br>这个仪器能够检测出有毒气体的存在。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|silly|英['sɪli] 美['sɪli]|adj.愚蠢的；琐屑的；可笑的；犯晕的<br>n.（通常指小孩子）淘气鬼；傻孩子|The silly ending robs the plot of any credibility.<br>Don't get upset over silly things that people say.<br>I look pretty silly in this dress.<br>I took a swing at him and knocked him silly.<br>Listen, silly, we have to leave now.<br>He is not a silly boy,not by a jugful.<br>No, silly, those aren't your shoes!|这愚蠢的结尾使得整个情节变得一点都不可信。<br>不要在意人们的闲言碎语。<br>我穿这条裙看上去很可笑。<br>我挥拳打了他一下，把他打得晕头转向。<br>听着，小淘气鬼，我们现在得走了。<br>他不是一个傻孩子。<br>不对，傻孩子，那不是你的鞋！|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|standard|英['stændəd] 美['stændərd]|n.标准；规格；水准；军旗<br>adj.标准的；普通的；规范的；权威的|There is no absolute standard for beauty.<br>The government has an official standard for the purity of silver.<br>Washing machines have standard measurements to fit under kitchen units.<br>Such prices hit off with the standard of our life.<br>The ignominy of losing your standard, your eagle standard, became equally great.<br>Wagon bearing Milan's standard to inspire the army, pushed by elite troops armed with spears and light armour.<br>According to my height, what is my standard weight?<br>Searching handluggage at airports is now standard procedure.<br>Maintain a secure DB server using standard and advanced techniques.<br>In my mind, the hgihest standard to measure the ethics and morality is justice.<br>This is one of the standard books on the subject.|美是没有绝对的标准的。<br>政府对于银的纯度定有官方的规格。<br>洗衣机的长宽高都有一定的规格，这样才能和厨房家具成为一体。<br>这样的物价与我们的生活水准相符。<br>丢失军旗和鹰旗，所带来的耻辱，也变的同样重大起来。<br>军旗战车的米兰战旗能极大激励部队士气，由装备长矛和轻甲的精锐部队负责护卫。<br>根据我的身高，我的标准体重是多少？<br>在机场检查手提行李现在已成例行程序。<br>用规范的和先进的技术来安全地维护数据库服务器。<br>在我的思想中，衡量道德规范的最高标准就是公平。<br>这是有关这个问题的权威著作之一。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|stare|英[steə(r)] 美[ster]|v.盯着看；凝视<br>n.凝视|She stared him into silence.<br>They all stared with astonishment.<br>It's impolite to stare at people.<br>You can enjoy its beauty each time you stare at its wonderment.<br>I see his eyes curiously stare on me.<br>Peter looked at them with glazy stare.<br>She gave him a long cool stare.|她把他盯得不吭声了。<br>他们全都惊讶地瞪着眼。<br>盯着看人是不礼貌的。<br>每当你凝视它，你都能重温旧梦。<br>我看见他的眼睛好奇地盯着我。<br>彼得用呆滞的目光凝视他们。<br>她冷冷地久久凝视他。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|string|英[strɪŋ] 美[strɪŋ]|n.线；弦；一串；字串<br>vt.串起；收紧；悬挂；系；扎；抽去筋；使紧张；使兴奋<br>vi.连成一串|Puppets are worked by strings.<br>The E string of the violin needs screwing up.<br>We have had a string of complaints about the program.<br>If the logon fails, an empty string is returned.<br>She strung the beads with a fine nylon.<br>Don't make your nerves string.<br>Lanterns were strung in the trees around the pool.<br>I bent down to tie the string to the dog's collar.<br>One end of that string was not fast to my heart.<br>I need a piece of string to tie this parcel up.<br>Winston undid the bit of string that held his overalls together.<br>He is highly strung for the game.|木偶是用线来操纵的。<br>这只小提琴的 E 弦需要调紧些。<br>我们已经收到了对该节目的一连串投诉。<br>如果登录失败，则返回空字符串。<br>她用细尼龙线把珠子串了起来。<br>你别太紧张啦！<br>水池周围的树上悬挂著灯笼。<br>我弯下身去将绳子系在狗的颈圈上。<br>线的一头不是系在我的心上。<br>我需要一根细绳把这包裹扎起来。<br>温斯顿把扎住工作服的一根绳子解开。<br>他对比赛非常紧张。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|support|英[sə'pɔːt] 美[sə'pɔːrt]|vt.支持；承受；支撑；供养；资助；证实；支援；担任演出嘉宾<br>n.支持；支撑；援助；供养；依据；助演嘉宾|The lawyer cite a previous case to support his argument.<br>Will you use your influence to prevail upon them to support the suggestion?<br>The pillars support the weight of the roof.<br>Is this bridge strong enough to support heavy lorries?<br>Her father supported her until she got married.<br>He needs a high income to support such a large family.<br>Will the government provide money to support the arts?<br>Our company has tied up with another firm to support the show.<br>These findings support my primary diagnosis.<br>Your testimony will support his plea of innocence.<br>They were all on fire to support the disaster area.<br>We are trying our utmost to support the construction of the border areas.<br>They were supported by a local band.<br>She spoke in support of the project.<br>They hope to win mass support among the middle class.<br>She was leaning on his arm for support.<br>High back provides great support for your neck.<br>You have no title to ask for our support.<br>She dispensed with the financial support of her uncle.<br>The child is dependent on his parents for support.<br>The statistics offer further support for our theory.<br>The support has yet to be confirmed.|律师引用了以前的案例来支持他的论点。<br>你能不能利用你的影响劝他们支持这个建议呢？<br>这些柱子支撑着屋顶的重量。<br>这座桥禁得住重型卡车通行吗？<br>她父亲抚养她直到她结婚。<br>他需要有高收入才能供养得起这样一个大家庭。<br>政府会拨款资助美术事业吗？<br>我们公司和另一公司联合资助展览。<br>这些发现证实了我的初步诊断。<br>你的证言将证实他的无罪抗辩。<br>他们都急切地要支援灾区。<br>我们尽力支援边疆建设。<br>当地的一支乐队为他们作助兴演出。<br>她发言支持这项计划。<br>他们希望能赢得中产阶级的广泛支持。<br>她靠在他的胳膊上寻求支撑。<br>高靠背可更好地支撑颈部。<br>你没有资格求我们援助。<br>她放弃了她叔叔对她的经济援助。<br>这个小孩靠他的父母养活。<br>这些统计数字为我们的理论提供了进一步的依据。<br>助演尚未确定。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|whisper|英['wɪspə(r)] 美['wɪspər]|n.低语；窃窃私语；飒飒的声音<br>vi.低声说；窃窃私语；飒飒地响<br>vt.耳语；私语|She said it in a whisper, so I didn't hear.<br>I heard the whisper of wind in the pines.<br>The children were whispering in the corner.<br>You'll have to whisper or he'll hear you.<br>She whisper to me so no one else will hear.<br>It is bad manners to whisper in company.<br>Don't you know it's rude to whisper?<br>The wind was whispering in the roof.<br>Fatso leaned over to whisper in her ear.<br>They love to whisper intimately.<br>When the teacher turned around , they began to whisper.|她是悄声说的，所以我没有听见。<br>我听见风吹过松林间飒飒作响。<br>孩子们正在角落里低声耳语。<br>你们得低声说，否则他会听到。<br>她低声跟我说话以免别人听见。<br>在众人面前窃窃私语是不礼貌的行为。<br>难道你不知道窃窃私语是不礼貌的吗？<br>屋顶上风声飒飒。<br>胖子欠身对她耳语几句。<br>他们爱亲密地耳语。<br>老师一转过身去，他们就开始窃窃私语。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|whistle|英['wɪsl] 美['wɪsl]|n.口哨；汽笛；警笛<br>v.吹口哨；鸣汽笛；呼啸；吹口哨召唤|The whistle goes at the end of the match.<br>He gave a loud whistle of gladness.<br>The whistle went and the man knocked off for lunch.<br>The horse shied at the shrill whistle.<br>The little boy rounded his lips to whistle.<br>The referee whistled and the game began.<br>He whistled to his friend to keep hidden.<br>We used to hear the train whistle at night.<br>A bullet whistled past his head.<br>The wind whistled through a crack in the door.|比赛结束时哨声响了。<br>他吹了一声响亮的口号表示高兴。<br>汽笛响了，工人们停工午餐。<br>那匹马听到刺耳的汽笛声，惊得往后倒退。<br>那个小男孩把双唇收圆好吹口哨。<br>裁判哨子一响，比赛开始了。<br>他吹口哨通知朋友继续隐蔽。<br>过去我们常会在晚上听到火车的汽笛声。<br>一颗子弹从他头顶上呼啸而过。<br>风从门的裂缝中呼呼地刮了进来。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|widespread|英['waɪdspred] 美['waɪdspred]|adj.分布（或散布）广的；普遍的|The high cost prohibits the widespread use of the drug.<br>Widespread flooding is affecting large areas of Devon.<br>The Government acted quickly to relieve the widespread distress caused by the earthquake.<br>The new laws gained widespread acceptance.<br>English is more widespread and more used in international intercourse than German.<br>The news of the radiation leak caused widespread public alarm.|该药因价格昂贵而影响其被广泛应用。<br>洪水泛滥，淹没了德文郡的广大地区。<br>地震造成大范围的灾难，政府迅速采取行动赈济灾民。<br>新法例广获赞同。<br>英语在国际交往中比德语使用得更为广泛。<br>辐射泄露的消息引起了公众的普遍恐慌。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|worthy|英['wɜːði] 美['wɜːrði]|adj.有价值的；可尊敬的；值得的；配得上的<br>n.知名人士；杰出人物|This is a worthy English-Chinese dictionary.<br>This book is worthy of reading.<br>No man thinks more highly than I do of the patriotism, as well as abilities, of the very worthy gentlemen who have just addressed the house.<br>Mr. Foker himself is a worthy man, though not of high extraction or indeed much education.<br>The event is worthy of being remembered.<br>His behavior is worthy of praise.<br>The book is well worthy of his reputation.<br>I want you to sell these two and find more worthy replacements.|这是一本有价值的英汉词典。<br>这本书值得一读。<br>没有人比我对刚刚向议会全体代表发言的可尊敬的先生们的爱国精神和才干更钦佩了。<br>福克先生本人也是值得尊敬的，尽管他出身不太高贵，受的教育确实也有限。<br>那事件是值得记忆的。<br>他的行为值得称道。<br>这本书完全配得上他的声望。<br>我需要你卖这些二和发现更多杰出人物替换。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|would|英[wʊd] 美[wʊd]|aux.将；可能；大概；总会；愿意；will 的过去式|The president proclaimed that a new currency would be issued.<br>He would have lost his position if you hadn't backed him up.<br>It would take about 30 minutes.<br>Every time he saw me, he would say hello to me.<br>Would you help me with the report?|总统宣布将发行新货币。<br>假如你当初没有支持他，他可能已经失去职位了。<br>大概要开 30 分钟。<br>每当他看见我，总向我问好。<br>你愿意帮我写报告吗？|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|wound|英[wuːnd] 美[wuːnd]|n.创伤；伤害；伤口<br>v.伤；伤害；缠绕（动词 wind 的过去式和过去分词）|I hope her emotional wound will heal with the passing of time.<br>She got deep psychological wounds.<br>The soldier received a serious wound on the chest.<br>That was a wound to the child's pride.<br>The wound is healing fast.<br>The wound was bound up by bandage.<br>Two soldiers died and three others were wounded in the attack.<br>He was deeply wounded by their disloyalty.<br>You should pay attention not to wound his pride.|我希望她感情上的创伤能随时间的流逝而治愈。<br>她受到很深的心理创伤。<br>这名士兵胸部受了重伤。<br>那是对孩子自尊心的伤害。<br>伤口愈合得很快。<br>伤口用绷带包扎着。<br>在这次袭击中，有两名士兵牺牲，三名受伤。<br>因为他们不忠，他十分伤心。<br>注意不要伤害他的自尊心。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|wrestle|英['resl] 美['resl]|v.摔跤；斗争；努力解决；斟酌<br>n.摔跤比赛；格斗|He wrestled his opponent to the floor/ground.<br>He taught his little brother how to wrestle.<br>We have to wrestle with difficulties.<br>We must wrestle with the problem.<br>The minister wrestled over the wording of the communique.<br>They are going to wrestle a match next month.|他把对手摔倒在地上。<br>他教他小弟弟如何摔跤。<br>我们必须同困难作斗争。<br>我们必须尽全力解决该问题。<br>部长斟酌公报的措辞。<br>他们下月要进行一场摔跤比赛。|高中英语单词
高中英语单词|wrinkle|英['rɪŋkl] 美['rɪŋkl]|n.皱纹；方法<br>vt.使起皱纹；皱着<br>vi.起皱|She's beginning to get wrinkles round her eyes.<br>My findings add a new wrinkle to each scenario.<br>Too much sunbathing will wrinkle your skin.<br>He wrinkled up his forehead in perplexity.<br>The apples are beginning to wrinkle.<br>Spread the varnish thin if you don't want it to wrinkle.|她的眼角开始有皱纹了。<br>我的发现为两种说法都提供了一点想法。<br>皮肤晒得过分就能起皱纹。<br>他困惑地皱起了眉头。<br>这些苹果开始起皱纹了。<br>如果你不想让它起皱就把油漆涂薄。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|writing|英['raɪtɪŋ] 美['raɪtɪŋ]|n.写作；著述；笔迹；作品|Writing is his life.<br>She is endowed with great writing ability.<br>She doesn't earn much from her writing.<br>Throughout his lifetime Lai Zhide strove to become a sage and was devoted to writing in seclusion with the wish of attaining spiritual immortality.<br>I can't read the doctor's writing.<br>It's really difficult to read your writing.<br>Have you read his writings?<br>His writing contains some real goodies.<br>The word play in his writing is very witty.|写作是他的生命。<br>她具有杰出的写作天赋。<br>她写作得到的收入不多。<br>在人生态度上，来氏有圣贤之志，毕生隐居著述，而有不朽的愿望。<br>我看不明白那位医生的笔迹。<br>你的笔迹真是难以辨认。<br>你读过他的作品吗？<br>他的作品中含有真正引人入胜的东西。<br>他作品中的双关语诙谐风趣。|高中英语单词

高中英语单词|anchor|英['æŋkə(r)] 美['æŋkər]|n.锚；锚状物；依靠；新闻节目主播；压阵队员<br>v.抛锚；停泊；用锚系住；担任（广播电视新闻节目）的主持人|The ship dragged its anchor during the night.<br>Hope is his only anchor.<br>He was then doing the anchor.<br>The anchor man in a relay team runs last.<br>The ship was anchored off the shore.<br>We anchored our boat close to the shore.<br>He anchors a half-hour news show every day.|夜里，船把锚拖动了。<br>希望是他唯一的依靠。<br>他当时正主持新闻广播节目。<br>接力队中的主力跑最后一棒。<br>船在海岸处抛了锚。<br>我们近岸泊船。<br>他每天主持半小时的新闻广播。|高中英语单词
